The party is nominally independent but has strong links to the [[Muslim Brotherhood in Egypt|Muslim Brotherhood of Egypt]], the largest and best organized political group in Egypt. It has stated that it plans to run candidate in just under half of all constituencies in the upcoming parliamentary election. == History == The [[Muslim Brotherhood]] announced on 21 February 2011, in the aftermath of the [[2011 Egyptian revolution]], that it intended to found the Freedom and Justice Party, set to be led by Dr. Saad Ketatni.[http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/muslim-brotherhood-establish-freedom-and-justice-party Muslim Brotherhood to establish 'Freedom and Justice Party' | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt][http://www.ikhwanweb.com/article.php?id=28088 Ikhwanweb :: The Muslim Brotherhood Official English Website][http://www.jpost.com/MiddleEast/Article.aspx?id=209563&R=R3 Muslim Brotherhood sits at Egyptâs new democratic table] The party was officially founded on 30 April 2011, and it was announced that it would contest up to half the seats in the upcoming [[Egyptian parliamentary election, 2011|parliamentary election]]. The Muslim Brotherhoodâs legislative body appointed Mohamed Morsy as president of the Freedom and Justice Party, Essam al-Erian as vice president and Saad al-Katatny as secretary general.http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/418600http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-13249434 The three are former members of the Muslim Brotherhood "Guidance Office" or ''Maktab al-Irshad'', the highest level body of the Egyptian Muslim Brotherhood.''Foreign Affairs magazine'', September October 2011, "The Unbreakable Muslim Brotherhood", by Eric Trager, p.114-222 (full text not available for free on internet) The party is expected to win "the vast majority" of the seats that it contests in the 2011 parliamentary election -- i.e. just under half of the seats in parliament -- as "no other party" has "anything close to the network of committed supporters" that it has. In addition the MB is working with independent candidates promising them support.''Foreign Affairs magazine'', September October 2011, "The Unbreakable Muslim Brotherhood", by Eric Trager, p.114-222 == Political platform == On launching the new party, the Muslim Brotherhood confirmed that it does not object to women or [[Copts]] in a ministerial post (cabinet),[http://www.ikhwanweb.com/article.php?id=28077 MB announces establishment of political party: Freedom and Justice].
